intro: Episcia silvatica, commonly known as the forest episcia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family, which includes many ornamental plants. This plant is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and glossy, often with a waxy coating. Episcia silvatica thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on trees or in the understory of dense forests.
